result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl E. Smith III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall take prescriptions in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.

Defendant Earl E. Smith in court (in custody) with attorney Katherine Seifert. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Evaluations received by both counsel and defendant. 
Statements by DA Snider requesting that Court adopt Dr. Berney's findings and adopt out-patient order. 
Counsel does not object to both physicans' reports being admitted without further testimony. 
Court finds defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, but may be after treatment. 
Court orders defendant committed on an out-patient basis for a period of 1 year. 
Court further orders involuntary administrative of medications to defendant. 
Review date to be set after first evaluation is completed.
